intro: Guettarda sordida, commonly known as the sour apple tree, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The plant produces small, round fruits that are typically sour and acidic, hence its common name. It thrives in humid, warm climates and is often found in coastal areas and lowland forests. Guettarda sordida is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes used in traditional medicine.
